I had to pay an extra Â£20 for a room upgrade with a window as we could not stick the heat in the room. The second evening there was nobody attending the bar, there was 3 receptionists chatting across the way at reception, I approached them and asked if could they get me a glass of ice for the room from the bar, they would not, they said to wait until the bar person came back, so we sat and waited, 20 minutes later no sign of the bar person yet, I asked them would they walk behind the bar and get me a glass of ice, they still would not and was told to wait for the bar person. the bar person arrived 30 minutes later and provided us with a glass of ice for the room. The level of service was disgraceful, considering the receptionists were doing nothing but chatting with each other. It does not give me a good opinion of Britannia hotels.

Negative Reviews:
Kind of got what expected I for the money. But i have been at better places for same value and location with just a LITTLE bit better standards. But there is a few things that should have been there, for the price. 
Yes it's an old design interior and i chose the cheapest room.
But the biggest conplaint i really have, is the mattress.
Im just an 183 cm, 86kg guy. I was literaly sleeping on the springs from the mattress. I never thought hotels would have those kind of mattress anymore, but this one had. I woke up with a very hard back/neck from the 3 nights that I was there. They could have gotten a better/updated mattress or just a thick mattress topper.


Next one is... there was no toiletbrush.... how in the world can i clean up after my hotspots....

Next.... The cheapest room we got had no windows which we were awere of, but it seemed like the room had no working ventilation. So it got very hot especially at night. Theres was just a fan in the room, that says it enough.

Last one... i got no information about any roomservice and how i could get more toiletpaper. I went to the receptionist to get more toiletpaper. 
A week earlier i was at a hotel in Sweden where they said at the reception when i booked in: if i would need room service, I'd have to contact the receptionist in advanced, to reduce cost and stuff like that. Which was nice.

Overall, if all those "minor mistakes" would have been fixed, it would have been a waaaayyyyy better experience.

Review Title: Excellent location, reasonable price, lovely staff. Not ideal for longer stays.
Negative Reviews:
In relation to perceived problems with the room, I can appreciate that any ongoing renovations or maintenance might have been affected by previous lockdown and COVID regulations, or other external circumstances. 
However, these are some other minor details that might put off potential guests:

- My biggest concern was to do with the door between my room and the one next door, which did not have an appropriate cover/shield over the keyhole. Instead, it was stuffed with tissue paper. 
Although I didn't complain at the time, I found this a bit unsettling regarding guest privacy, safety, and comfort. 

- Secondly, I had access to complimentary tea/coffee with a kettle and cups, but no drinking water. Instead, I had to get this from the vending machine on the ground floor. 
This might not seem like a big deal, but for most hotel guests, every penny counts. This should have been a fair expectation after I had already spent a reasonable, though for me, not an insignificant amount of money. 

- Finally, although it isn't a cheap feature, it would have been made better if there had been a laundry service included. 
I don't usually stay in hotels for any longer than a night, but for two nights or longer - it's a necessity. 
Not ideal when you're in a part of the city that doesn't have easy access to a self-service laundrette.

The quality of the room alone "met my expectations", but only just.
Positive Reviews: Although in desperate need of an update, this is a great spot for a short stay, just around the corner from Piccadilly and a short walk from the train station. In the summer months, it's ideal for hitting spots around Oxford Street where you have access to some brilliant vintage shops, cafÃ©s, and pubs. The price of the room was reasonable for a three night stay, and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room itself was clean and very spacious, with a working television and a very comfy double bed.
the location was really good

Review Title: If you stay here don't touch anything or have a shower. You'll likely be cleaner this way.
Negative Reviews:
The interior rooms didn't have air con so was like sleeping in a sauna. The staff on the door were a bit useless and it took ages to check in. We were told about the power trip bouncers that would be on the door so getting back in to the rooms was a nightmare after 11. If you're nervous about leaving stuff in your room, don't worry. There's no chance anyone will pop in and steal it as there don't appear to be any cleaning staff. 

The beer in the bar tastes like it has been in the pipes for about 3 months before you get there. Oh and there's an awful hissing in there too which I'm assuming is to keep air moving in rooms without sunshine. It's the most irritating thing in the world. Beds are like slate and the pillows are like rocks. 

It's even the little things like 2 of the 3 doors into the building not working but no sign to tell you this. They just let you hang around a look a fool.

I hope these small recommendations are taken reasonably as mentioned above if in Manchester again for a concert/night out I will be a returning customer.

Thanks for the stay.
Positive Reviews:
So itâ€™s only fair to give this hotel a good honest review.

This hotel was booked for a concert taking place at the o2 Ritz. Myself and a mate booked the hotel based on location and lowest price.

We paid Â£69 for one night and was booked as a room with no windows.

Upon arrival my pal took a picture of the front of the hotel for his Instagram. Almost immediately a friend of his who lives in Manchester replied â€œNOâ€ we then got the story of the hotels reviews and reputationâ€¦

Now after hearing from a trusted source that out hotel was branded one of the worst in Manchester we were quick to check Trip Advisor.

Trip Advisor brands this hotel 2/5 and â€œPoorâ€.

Reviews include: rooms that are broken into, prostitutes that steal your money who sit in the bar area & then the various specimens & goods within the room. Such as â€œpoo on the bed sheets & a baguette and glasses underneath the bedâ€

Now for my review.

We checked in swiftly as soon as we entered the hotel lobby we were greeted and checked in within a matter of 2/3 minutes. We were asked if we would like a smoking or non smoking room. To which my friend replied â€œI didnâ€™t know that they even existed. As non smokers we opted for a non smoking room.

Our room was based upon the second floor which was accessible by the lift.

Upon entry to our room we were pleasantly surprised to have been â€œupgradedâ€ to a room with a window.

2 single beds. A cute petit TV. Table with kettle and a sandwich bag of tea/ coffee etc.

This hotel did not live up to the horrendous reviews we had read online. You have to question peoples opinions when as the saying goes â€œYou get what you pay forâ€.

For 2 lads going to a concert and using the hotel as a base it was great. Cheap, central & convenient.

Before being overly put off by reviews give it a chance all that being dependant what you are staying for!

Myself and my pal will happily be staying at this hotel again for concert/clubbing purposes.

Negative Reviews:
There were a couple of things. We checked in and asked if we could have 2 glasses from the bar, the reception guy said just got to the bar. We went to the bar they sent us back to reception. Needless to say we went up without glasses. 
The main thing was I clicked pay at property, we were staying on the Friday night, the hotel took the money out the Tuesday before. I questioned this as it wasn't actually me paying on the day, they said it was because it was a busy weekend and they wanted to make sure room was paid for etc however you could still book a room at this hotel in the Friday. I checked. 
They then said it was in a holding and if I cancelled before Friday I would get it back. I just went along with it, put my card in the machine the Friday when we got there, it was approved of course but the money didn't then leave my bank till the Tuesday after. Now I have stayed in many hotels and paid several ways and never has this happened before. 
I do feel there was no reason for this other than the fact I had down graded my original room as we were going to arrive later.
So just be careful withe the pay at property option for this hotel

Review Title: Not really the 'bang for my bucks' that I was hoping for!
Negative Reviews:
The rooms are tired, not particularly decorative but the finish in the rooms is poor. You wouldn't accept a finish like that at your own home.

Only 1 window with a net curtain therefore could only open 1 set of curtains as we were overlooked by other buildings.

Shower was pathetic, the dribble of water that did come out was hot though but not in any great quantity, it was probably one of those water saving showers.

To be honest, other than the location of this hotel, there is no other reason for the price - which frankly I thought was extortionate. Just because other hotels in the area charge the same price doesn't warrant this hotel following suit. With a hand on my heart, I feel like this is a Â£60 a night room.

There's nothing particularly wrong with it but when you consider that for an extra Â£126 I could actually get 6 nights all inclusive in Greece (which I have done) it kind of puts things into perspective a little!

Last thing that really grated on me was the 10am check-out time. That's early, especially for a Sunday morning and it cut across breakfast too which was 8 - 10...like - what am I supposed to do - eat breakfast or check out?

Writting this review has certainly focused my thoughts on my 1 night stay at Â£124 and I'm not saying that this hotel is any better or worse than any others in the area but I do actually feel like I was taken advantage of. When I can't say that there was 1 thing that stood out that was nice or embraced me as a customer, I felt like I was more of a burden.

There was also a massive weed problem during our stay, the whole hotel stunk of cannabis, to the extent that I hope I don't get drugs tested anytime soon because there's no way I couldn't have ingested that through secondary smoke inhalation.
Positive Reviews:
Location is fantastic, breakfast was included.

The door men were grand, they actually were the people who had more time and interaction with the guests than the actual hotel staff and nothing was too much trouble for them, they were really friendly, very polite and well mannered - they were the highlight of the stay really.

If you choose to stay at Sacha's, perhaps ask for a room far away from the bar next to Affleks, if you want a decent night's sleep.
